intro: Melampyrum americanum, commonly known as American touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its flowers are often reddish or orange in color, with two lips that resemble a face, giving it its common name. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds.
